sources.title: WhatButlerSaw
sources.description: Title: What the Butler Saw Summary: A British nobleman who has spent the majority of his life running a tropical island returns to England. He finds that an island princess has fallen in love with his butler. Finding that ... Directed by: Godfrey Grayson Actors: Edward Rigby, Henry Mollison, Mercy Haystead Production Company: Hammer Films Release Date: June 1950 (UK) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 A British nobleman who has spent the majority of his life running a tropical island returns to England. He finds that an island princess has fallen in love with his butler. Finding that unseemly, he sets out to break up the budding romance and send the woman back where she came from. Complications ensue.

sources.title: What the Butler Saw
sources.description: “Surprise package” “Unsuccessful” “Amusing B-feature” “Interesting idea -- dull execution” (IMDB reviews quotes). An uneven British farce that has its moments, but the script often lets down the cast. Edward Rigby and Henry Mollison costar. Adequate production values. Watching it won’t kill you, but there are better ways to spend 60 minutes. IMDB rating 5.5. Directed by Godfrey Grayson. Released in 1950 (UK). Complete print. CAST NOTE: Peter Burton’s feature film debut.

metadata.Plot: A British nobleman who has spent the majority of his life running a tropical island returns to England. He finds that an island princess has fallen in love with his butler. Finding that unseemly, he sets out to break up the budding romance and send the woman back where she came from. Complications ensue.
metadata.Writer: Donald Good, Roger Good, Edward J. Mason
metadata.Actors: Edward Rigby, Henry Mollison, Mercy Haystead
